title: Zharkent
text:
Zharkent or Jarkent (, "Jarkent"), formerly known as "Panfilov" (, until 1991) and "Dzharkent" (, until 1942), is a <a href="Cities%20of%20Kazakhstan">city</a> which serves as the administrative center of <a href="Panfilov%20District%2C%20Kazakhstan">Panfilov District</a> in the <a href="Almaty%20Region">Almaty Region</a>, Kazakhstan. It is located near the Usek river, not far from the <a href="Ili%20river">Ili river</a>. The city's population totaled 42,617 as of 2019.
The town was founded in 1882 as "Dzharkent". From 1942 until 1991 it was named "Panfilov" after <a href="Ivan%20Panfilov">Ivan Panfilov</a>, the <a href="Russia">Russia</a>n <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> hero who died in battle in 1941. Zharkent is well known for its nineteenth-century <a href="Zharkent%20Mosque">great mosque</a>, commissioned by a wealthy merchant and community leader named Vali Bay. It is notable for its unique mix of Chinese and Central Asian styles of architecture.
Demographics.
